hospital.model

Class EmergencyConditions

  • java.lang.Object
    • hospital.model.EmergencyConditions

  • public class EmergencyConditions
extends java.lang.Object
    This class stores and provides information about various emergency conditions recognized by the hospital's ER. Conditions and their triage ratings are loaded from a configuration file at the time the EmergeyConditions object is created.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      EmergencyConditions(java.lang.String fileName)
      Creates a new EmergencyConditions object based on comma separated data provided in a specified configuration file.

    • Method Summary

    • Constructor Detail

      • EmergencyConditions

        public EmergencyConditions(java.lang.String fileName)
                    throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Creates a new EmergencyConditions object based on comma separated data provided in a specified configuration file. This method assumes that the file, if present, is valid and contains a series of records formatted as: 
        Condition Name,#

        Where "Condition Name" is a string of potentially several words (including spaces and special characters like hypens) and # is a single integer value in the range 1-5 (inclusive) corresponding to the associated triage level.

        Parameters:
        fileName - The name of the configuration file to be read.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - occurs when the specified file does not exist or cannot be opened for reading.

    • Method Detail

      • timeThreshold

        public static int timeThreshold(int priority)
        This method retrieves triage compliance thresholds (in minutes) per fixed hospital policy. The rules are:

        Priority 1: Immediate attention required and should be seen immediately with a 0 minute wait.
        Priority 2: Very urgent attention needed and should be seen within 10 minutes of arriving.
        Priority 3: Urgent attention needed and should be seen within 60 minutes of arriving.
        Priority 4: Standard attention. Should be seen within 2 hours.
        Priority 5: Not an emergency. Should be seen within 4 hours of arriving.

        Parameters:
        priority - The priority level of interest.
        Returns:
        The wait threshold corresponding to the specified priority.
        Throws:
        InvalidPriorityException - when the priority specified lies outside of the range 1-5, inclusive.

      • lookup

        public int lookup(java.lang.String conditionName)
        This method looks up the priority level for a specified condition per the hospital's current configuration file. String matches are considered in a case-sensitive manner, including spacing and punctuation.
        Parameters:
        conditionName - A string containing the condition of interest.
        Returns:
        A priority value 1-5 corresponding to the provided condition.
        Throws:
        InvalidConditionException - if a condition is specified that does not exist in the hospital's configuration file.
